title: CSS Intro
desc: Cascading Style Sheets are used to style your html.

title: CSS Structure/Syntax
desc: Each css block follows a specific layout. Selector { property:value }

title: CSS How to Embed
desc: There are three ways of inserting a style sheet.

title: Colors
desc: Colors are displayed combining RED, GREEN, and BLUE (RGB).

title: Backgrounds
desc: To put a background on your document edit the element's background property.

title: Borders
desc: Add border to your elements and edit types of borders.

title: Margins
desc: Margin is space around an element.

title: Padding
desc: Padding adds space around content.

title: Height and Width
desc: Controlt the dimensions of your element via height and width.

title: Text
desc: Format your text's layout and color.

title: Fonts
desc: Font property edits the texts font type, boldness, size and style.

title: Links
desc: Style links to make them look like buttons or more decorative.

title: Lists
desc: Edit list's properties to change way they are displayed

title: Tables
desc: Improve the way your table data looks.

title: Box Model (IMPORTANT)
desc: Box model shows that total width and height of and elements is total = margin + border + padding + content

title: Outline
desc: Outline is drawn outside a and elements border.

title: Display
desc: Display specifies how and element is displayed or if it even is displayed at all.

title: Max-Width Margin
desc: Set an elements max width and center the element.

title: Position
desc: There are 4 different types of positions (static, relative, fixed, absolute)

title: Float and Clear
desc: Float specifies if an element should float and clear helps control floats.

title: Inline Block
desc: Elements have width and height and can be inline. Great to be paired with float.

title: Align
desc: Learn how to center, left and right align elements.

title: Combinators
desc: Traverse the DOM by selectors.

title: Pseudo-classes
desc: Use pseudo class to define a certain state of an element

title: Pseudo-elements
desc: Pseudo-element is used to style specified parts of an element

title: Navigation Bar
desc: Having navigation bar is a must for any website to make navigating through your website easy.

title: Dropdowns
desc: Dropdown menu

title: Tooltip
desc: Use tooltips to provide more information when user hovers over an element.

title: Image Gallery
desc: Create and image gallery.

title: Image Opacity/Transparency
desc: Change an image's transparency.

title: Image Sprites
desc: Combine a collection of images into one image to save server requests and bandwidth.

title: Attribute Selectors
desc: Style css selectors by their attribute.

title: Forms
desc: Design forms to look better and easier to use.

title: Counters
desc: Counters are like variables to keep track of how many times an element is used.

title: CSS3 Intro
desc: New modules that were added selectors, backgrounds, animations, text effects, user interface etc...

title: Rounded Corners - CSS3
desc: With border-radius you can round your border edges.

title: Border Images - CSS3
desc: With border-image property you can use image as a border.

title: Backgrounds - CSS3
desc: You can add multiple backgrounds to one image.

title: Colors - CSS3
desc: You can use names, hexadecimal, rgb, and hsla to set colors

title: Gradients - CSS3
desc: Display transitions between two or more colors.

title: Shadow Effects - CSS3
desc: You can add shadow to images, texts and borders

title: Text - CSS3
desc: Control text now to prevent overflowing

title: Web Fonts - CSS3
desc: Add web fonts that are not on user's computer

title: 2D Transforms - CSS3
desc: CSS3 transforms has the ability to translate, rotate, scale, and skew elements.

title: 3D Transforms - CSS3
desc: Allows you to format your elements using 3D transformations.

title: Transitions - CSS3
desc: Transitions allows you to change property values over a given duration.

title: Animations - CSS3
desc: Gives you ability to animate most HTML elements without javascript or flash

title: Images - CSS3
desc: Style images by creating thumbnails, rounded or become responsive

title: Buttons - CSS3
desc: Style buttons to be more presentable

title: Pagination - CSS3
desc: Pagination is to show only part of the information at a time.

title: Multiple Columns - CSS3
desc: Create a newspaper like multi-column layout.

title: User Interface - CSS3
desc: Ability to resize elements and more.

title: Box Sizing - CSS3
desc: You can now specify pre compiled box sizing.

title: Flexible Box (IMPORTANT)
desc: Use of flexbox ensures that elements behave predictably when the page layout must accommodate different screen sizes and different display devices.

title: Media Queries - CSS3
desc: @media will allow you to apply different set of rules based on width and height of the viewport.

title: CSS Responsive Web Design
desc: To display web pages that look good on all devices you need to have a responsive web design (RWD).

title: CSS References
desc: Additional resources
